meanings.definition: A type of vegetable with white leaves and a bitter taste.
meanings.sent1: I tried a new recipe that included witloof, and it added a unique flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested fresh witloof from the garden to sell at the market.
meanings.sent3: Why did the witloof refuse to play hide-and-seek? Because it couldn't find a dark enough spot!
meanings.sent4: The witloof stood out in the garden like a ghostly presence among the green vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of witloof lingered on my tongue long after I finished eating.

meanings.definition: The edible shoot of a chicory plant, typically grown in darkness to produce a pale, tender head.
meanings.sent1: The chef carefully selected the freshest witloof to use in the salad.
meanings.sent2: After weeks of growing in the dark, the witloof was finally ready to be harvested.
meanings.sent3: Why did the witloof wear sunglasses? To protect its tender head from the bright light!
meanings.sent4: The pale witloof looked like a delicate flower blooming in the darkness of the cellar.
meanings.sent5: As I bit into the tender witloof, I could taste the hint of bitterness that made it unique.
